steps.cmd:
git init
git remote add origin https://github.com/user/repo.git
git config core.sparseCheckout true
echo "path/to/file1.txt" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
echo "path/to/file2.txt" >> .git/info/sparse-checkout
git pull origin main

python -m pip install --upgrade pip
pip install pytest

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y libpq-dev libssl-dev libffi-dev

pip install --upgrade pip
pip install -r requirements.txt

comments=$(curl -s -X GET \
  -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  "https://api.github.com/repos/$GITHUB_REPOSITORY/issues/${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}/comments")
for comment in $(echo "$comments" | jq -r '.[] | .body'); do
  if echo "$comment" | grep -q '\*\*\*no_ci\*\*\*'; then
    echo "Found '***no_ci***' in a comment. Failing the check."
    exit 1
  fi
done

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y build-essential

curl -X POST \
https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/issues/${{ github.event.issue.number }}/comments \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer '${GITHUB_TOKEN} \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{"body": "Syncing with Redmine..."}'

issue_title=$(curl -s -X GET \
https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/issues/${{ github.event.issue.number }} \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer '${GITHUB_TOKEN} | jq -r '.title')

issue_body=$(curl -s -X GET \
https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/issues/${{ github.event.issue.number }} \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer '${GITHUB_TOKEN} | jq -r '.body')

curl -X POST \
${REDMINE_URL}/issues.json \
-H 'X-Redmine-API-Key: '${REDMINE_API_KEY} \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{"issue": {"project_id": "your_project_id", "subject": "'"${issue_title}"'", "description": "'"${issue_body}"'"}}'

issue_number=$(curl -s -X GET \
https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/issues/${{ github.event.issue.number }} \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer '${GITHUB_TOKEN} | jq -r '.number')

redmine_issue_id=$(curl -s -X GET \
${REDMINE_URL}/issues.json?subject=${issue_number} \
-H 'X-Redmine-API-Key: '${REDMINE_API_KEY} | jq -r '.issues[0].id')

curl -X PUT \
${REDMINE_URL}/issues/${redmine_issue_id}.json \
-H 'X-Redmine-API-Key: '${REDMINE_API_KEY} \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{"issue": {"status_id": "closed"}}'

cat > master.cfg <<EOF
from buildbot.plugins import *
c = BuildmasterConfig = {}
c['workers'] = [worker.Worker("example-worker", "pass")]
c['protocols'] = {'pb': {'port': 9989}}
c['title'] = "My Buildbot"
c['titleURL'] = "https://example.com"
c['buildbotURL'] = "http://localhost:8010/"
c['www'] = dict(port=8010, plugins=dict(waterfall_view={}, console_view={}))
c['db'] = {'db_url': "sqlite:///state.sqlite"}
c['change_source'] = []
c['change_source'].append(changes.GitPoller(
    'https://github.com/myrepo/myproject.git',
    branches=True,
    pollInterval=300
))
c['schedulers'] = []
c['schedulers'].append(schedulers.SingleBranchScheduler(
    name="all",
    change_filter=util.ChangeFilter(branch_re=".*"),
    treeStableTimer=None,
    builderNames=["runtests"]
))
c['builders'] = []
c['builders'].append(
    util.BuilderConfig(
        name="runtests",
        workernames=["example-worker"],
        factory=util.BuildFactory([
            steps.Git(repourl='https://github.com/myrepo/myproject.git', mode='full'),
            steps.ShellCommand(command=["echo", "hello world"])
        ])
    )
)
EOF

buildbot create-master master
mv master.cfg master/
buildbot start master

sqlcmd -S ${{ secrets.DB_SERVER }} -d ${{ secrets.DB_NAME }} -Q "INSERT INTO db_version (version, deployed_at) VALUES ( '$(cat db_version.txt)', GETDATE() )"

  "https://api.github.com/repos/$GH_REPO/actions/runs?status=in_progress&per_page=100" \
  | jq '.workflow_runs[] | select(.name == "$GH_WORKFLOW") | .id' > runs.txt

# Get the highest priority run
highest_priority_run=$(cat runs.txt | head -n 1)

# Get the dependencies of the highest priority run
curl -s -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
  "https://api.github.com/repos/$GH_REPO/actions/runs/$highest_priority_run/jobs" \
  | jq '.jobs[] | .id' > job_ids.txt

# Requeue snapshot dependencies
for job_id in $(cat job_ids.txt); do
  curl -s -X POST -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
    "https://api.github.com/repos/$GH_REPO/actions/jobs/$job_id/rerun" \
    -d '{"enable_debug_logging":true}'

      (version packageInfo name = 'YourPackage') ifTrue: [

  ].
"

#!/bin/bash
curl -u $HUDSON_USERNAME:$HUDSON_PASSWORD "$HUDSON_URL/job/$JOB_NAME/lastBuild/api/json" -o build.json
RESULT=$(jq -r '.result' build.json)
if [ "$RESULT" = "SUCCESS" ]; then
  SUBJECT="Hudson CI Job $JOB_NAME Success"
else
  SUBJECT="Hudson CI Job $JOB_NAME Failure"
fi
curl -u $HUDSON_USERNAME:$HUDSON_PASSWORD "$HUDSON_URL/job/$JOB_NAME/lastBuild/testReport/api/json" -o testReport.json
TEST_SUMMARY=$(jq -r '.failCount + .passCount' testReport.json)
TEST_FAILED=$(jq -r '.failCount' testReport.json)
TEST_PASSED=$(jq -r '.passCount' testReport.json)
BODY="Test Summary: $TEST_SUMMARY, Passed: $TEST_PASSED, Failed: $TEST_FAILED"

for fork in $(git ls-remote --heads --refs | grep -o 'refs/heads/.*' | sed 's/refs\/heads\///g' | grep -v '^master$\|^main$'); do
  git fetch https://github.com/${fork}.git +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/${fork}/*

RUN_ID=$(gh api /repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/actions/workflows/slave-workflow.yml/runs \
  --paginate \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  | jq '.workflow_runs | .[] | select(.status == "in_progress" or .status == "queued") | .id' \
  | tail -n 1)

while true; do
  STATUS=$(gh api /repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/actions/runs/${RUN_ID} \
    -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
    --silent \
    --fail \
    | jq -r '.status')

  if [ "$STATUS" == "completed" ]; then
    break
  fi

  sleep 10
done

# Get all commits that are not merged
COMMITS=$(git log --format=%H --no-merges HEAD)

# Loop through each commit and create a PR for it
for COMMIT in $COMMITS; do
  git checkout $COMMIT
  COMMIT_MESSAGE=$(git log --format=%s -1)
  BRANCH_NAME=$(echo $COMMIT_MESSAGE | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | tr -cd '[:alnum:]-' | cut -c1-30)

  # Create a new branch for the commit
  git checkout -b $BRANCH_NAME

  # Push the branch to the remote repository
  git push origin $BRANCH_NAME

  # Create a PR for the branch
  PR_TITLE=$(echo $COMMIT_MESSAGE | cut -c1-50)
  PR_BODY="Automated PR for commit $COMMIT"
  gh pr create --title "$PR_TITLE" --body "$PR_BODY" --head $BRANCH_NAME --base main || true
done

    import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

    root = tree.getroot()
    for testcase in root.findall(".//TestCase"):
      name = testcase.get("name")
      time = 0.0  # default duration if not found
      for child in testcase:

          time = float(child.get("time", 0))

  '

echo "2. Deduplication: Git stores each file/blob only once, avoiding duplicates."
echo "3. Delta compression: Git stores differences between file versions, not entire files."
echo "4. Packfiles: Git packs related objects together, improving compression and access speed."
echo "5. Indexing: Git's index allows for fast lookup and comparison of file states."
echo "6. Locality: Git stores related data together, minimizing disk seeks and improving performance."

while IFS= read -r line; do
  if [[ $line =~ ^r[0-9]+ ]]; then
    revision=$(echo $line | cut -d' ' -f1)
    comment_url=$(curl -s -X GET \
      https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/commits/${GITHUB_SHA} \
      -H "Authorization: Bearer $GITHUB_TOKEN" | jq -r '.comments_url')
    curl -s -X POST \
      $comment_url \
      -H "Authorization: Bearer $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
      -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
      -d '{"body": "SVN changeset comment for revision '$revision':\n'"$(svn log -r $revision --username $SVN_USERNAME --password $SVN_PASSWORD --non-interactive --trust-server-cert $SVN_URL | tail -n +4)"'"}'
  fi
done < svn_comments.txt

python <<EOF
import numpy as np

def convolution_fourier(x, y):
  # Get the length of the input sequences
  n = len(x)
  m = len(y)

  # Calculate the length of the output sequence
  output_length = n + m - 1

  # Pad the input sequences with zeros
  x_padded = np.pad(x, (0, m-1))
  y_padded = np.pad(y, (0, n-1))

  # Perform FFT on the padded sequences
  X = np.fft.fft(x_padded)
  Y = np.fft.fft(y_padded)

  # Multiply the FFTs
  Z = X * Y

  # Perform inverse FFT
  z = np.real(np.fft.ifft(Z))

  return z

# Example usage
x = np.array([1, 2, 3])
y = np.array([4, 5, 6])

result = convolution_fourier(x, y)
print("Convolution result:", result)
EOF

for issue in $ISSUES; do
  echo "Processing issue $issue"
  curl -X GET \
    'https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPO}/issues/'$issue'/comments?per_page=100' \
    -H 'Authorization: token ${GITHUB_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json' > comments.json

    echo "$comment"
  done

  'https://${GIT_SERVER_URL}/api/v1/repos/${GIT_SERVER_REPO}/issues?state=all&per_page=100' \
  -H 'Authorization: token ${GIT_SERVER_TOKEN}' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' > git_server_issues.json
GIT_SERVER_ISSUES=$(jq '.[]' git_server_issues.json)
for issue in $GIT_SERVER_ISSUES; do
  ISSUE_TITLE=$(echo $issue | jq -r '.title')
  ISSUE_BODY=$(echo $issue | jq -r '.body')
  ISSUE_NUMBER=$(echo $issue | jq -r '.number')
  echo "Creating issue $ISSUE_NUMBER: $ISSUE_TITLE"
  curl -X POST \
    'https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPO}/issues' \
    -H 'Authorization: token ${GITHUB_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json' \
    -d '{"title": "'"$ISSUE_TITLE"'", "body": "'"$ISSUE_BODY"'"}'
  ISSUE_COMMENTS_URL=$(echo $issue | jq -r '.comments_url')
  curl -X GET \
    $ISSUE_COMMENTS_URL'?per_page=100' \
    -H 'Authorization: token ${GIT_SERVER_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'Accept: application/json' > issue_comments.json
  ISSUE_COMMENTS=$(jq '.[]' issue_comments.json)
  for comment in $ISSUE_COMMENTS; do
    COMMENT_BODY=$(echo $comment | jq -r '.body')

done

# Split test files into batches
TEST_FILES=$(find . -type f -name 'test_*.py')
NUM_FILES=$(echo "$TEST_FILES" | wc -l)
BATCH_SIZE=100
NUM_BATCHES=$(( (NUM_FILES + BATCH_SIZE - 1) / BATCH_SIZE ))

for ((i=0; i<NUM_BATCHES; i++)); do
  START=$(( i * BATCH_SIZE + 1 ))
  END=$(( (i + 1) * BATCH_SIZE ))
  echo "Running batch $((i+1))/$NUM_BATCHES (tests $START-$END)"

  # Get test files for this batch
  BATCH_TEST_FILES=$(echo "$TEST_FILES" | sed -n "$START,$END p")

  # Run pytest on the batch
  pytest -v $(echo "$BATCH_TEST_FILES")
done

from github import Github

try:
  master_ref = repo.get_git_ref('heads/master')
  branch_ref = repo.get_git_ref(f'heads/{'$BRANCH'}')

  merge_into_master = repo.merge(
    'master',
    branch_ref.object.sha,
    'Merge {0} into master'.format('$BRANCH')
  )

  print(f'Merged {'$BRANCH'} into master with commit {merge_into_master.sha}')
except Exception as e:
  print(f'Failed to merge {'$BRANCH'} into master: {str(e)}')
  exit(1)
"

changed_files=$(cat changed_files.txt)
declare -A file_types
for file in $changed_files; do
  extension="${file##*.}"
  if [ "$extension" == "$file" ]; then
    extension="unknown"
  fi
  file_types[$extension]=$(( ${file_types[$extension]-0} + 1 ))
done

echo "File types and count of changed files:"
for key in "${!file_types[@]}"; do
  echo "$key: ${file_types[$key]}"
done

echo "Changed lines per file type:"
for key in "${!file_types[@]}"; do
  count=0
  for file in $changed_files; do
    if [[ "$file" == *.$key ]]; then
      count=$(( $count + $(git diff --unified=0 -- HEAD~1 -- $file | grep -E "^\+|^-" | grep -Ev "^(---|\+\+\+)" | wc -l) ))
    fi
  done
  echo "$key: $count"
done

echo "::set-output name=file_types::${!file_types[@]}"
echo "::set-output name=changed_lines::$(for key in "${!file_types[@]}"; do count=0; for file in $changed_files; do if [[ "$file" == *.$key ]]; then count=$(( $count + $(git diff --unified=0 -- HEAD~1 -- $file | grep -E "^\+|^-" | grep -Ev "^(---|\+\+\+)" | wc -l) )); fi; done; echo "$key=$count"; done)"

# Create the webhook

-H "Authorization: Bearer ${AZURE_DEVOPS_TOKEN}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/hooks \
-d '{
      "name": "web",
      "active": true,
      "events": ["push"],
      "config": {
        "url": "'"${WEBHOOK_URL}"'",
        "content_type": "json"
      }
    }'

# Get the webhook ID
WEBHOOK_ID=$(curl -s -X GET \
-H "Authorization: token ${GITHUB_TOKEN}" \
https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/hooks | jq '.[] | select(.config.url=="'${WEBHOOK_URL}'") | .id')

# Update the webhook to send the repository name
curl -X PATCH \
-H "Authorization: token ${GITHUB_TOKEN}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/hooks/${WEBHOOK_ID} \
-d '{
      "config": {
        "url": "'"${WEBHOOK_URL}"'",
        "content_type": "json",
        "secret": "'"${AZURE_DEVOPS_TOKEN}"'"
      }
    }'

  PARENTS=($(git log -1 --merges --format=%P))
  if [[ $(git log --format=%B -1 ${PARENTS[1]}) =~ ^Merge.* ]]; then
    echo "Not a direct push or merge from non-release branch"
    exit 1
  fi
  if [[ $(git log --format=%B -1 ${PARENTS[1]}) =~ ^Merge\ pull\ request.* ]]; then
    SOURCE_BRANCH=$(git log --format=%s -1 ${PARENTS[1]} | sed -r 's/Merge pull request #[0-9]+ from ([^ ]+).*/\1/')
  else
    SOURCE_BRANCH=${PARENTS[1]}
  fi
  if [[ $SOURCE_BRANCH =~ ^releases/.* ]]; then
    echo "Merge from releases/* detected"
  else
    echo "Not a merge from releases/*"
    exit 1
  fi
else
  echo "Not a merge commit"

$account = "NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE"
$privileges = "SeBackupPrivilege", "SeRestorePrivilege"

foreach ($privilege in $privileges) {
  Write-Host "Granting $privilege to $account"
  $admin = New-Object System.Security.Principal.NTAccount($account)
  $id = [System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator
  $sid = $admin.Translate([System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier])
  secedit /export /cfg secconfig.cfg
  (Get-Content secconfig.cfg | Where-Object {$_ -notlike "$privilege = *"}) | Set-Content secconfig_new.cfg
  echo "$privilege = $sid" >> secconfig_new.cfg
  secedit /configure /db secedit.sdb /cfg secconfig_new.cfg
  Remove-Item secconfig.cfg, secconfig_new.cfg
}

jq -r '.values[] | "\(.id) \(.title) \(.source.branch.name) \(.destination.branch.name) \(.author.display_name)"' pullrequests.json | while read -r id title source_branch target_branch author; do
  echo "Importing PR $id: $title"
  git checkout -b "pr/$id" "$target_branch"
  git merge --no-commit --no-ff "$source_branch"
  git commit -m "PR $id: $title by $author"
  git push https://${GITHUB_TOKEN}@github.com/${GITHUB_REPO}.git "pr/$id"
  curl -X POST \
    https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPO}/pulls \
    -H 'Authorization: token '${GITHUB_TOKEN} \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d '{"title": "'"PR $id: $title"'", "body": "'"Imported from Bitbucket PR $id"'", "head": "'"pr/$id"'", "base": "'"$target_branch"'"}'
done

    git commit -m "Sync pull request template"
    git push https://${GITHUB_ACTOR}:${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}@github.com/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY_OWNER}/$repo.git main
  fi
  cd ..
  rm -rf $repo
done

-H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}" \
-H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
"https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/pulls?state=open" \
> prs.json

for pr in $(jq '.[] | .number' prs.json); do
  echo "Processing PR $pr"
  curl -s -X GET \
  -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  "https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/pulls/$pr" \
  > pr.json

  base_sha=$(jq -r '.base.sha' pr.json)
  head_sha=$(jq -r '.head.sha' pr.json)
  mergeable=$(jq -r '.mergeable' pr.json)
  state=$(jq -r '.state' pr.json)

  if [ "$state" == "open" ] && [ "$mergeable" == "true" ]; then
    curl -s -X GET \
    -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
    -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
    "https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/pulls/$pr/commits?per_page=1" \
    > commits.json
    latest_commit_sha=$(jq -r '.[0].sha' commits.json)

    if [ "$latest_commit_sha" == "$head_sha" ]; then
      curl -s -X PUT \
      -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
      -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
      "https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}/pulls/$pr/merge" \
      -d '{"merge_method":"merge"}'
      echo "Merged PR $pr"
    else
      echo "PR $pr has new commits, skipping merge"
    fi
  else
    echo "PR $pr is not mergeable or not open, skipping merge"
  fi
done

# Get changed files
files=$(git diff --name-only ${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }} ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }})

# Group files by directory
declare -A file_groups
for file in $files; do
  dir=$(dirname "$file")
  if [ "$dir" == "." ]; then
    dir="root"
  fi
  file_groups[$dir]+=" $file"
done

# Create new branches and PRs for each group
for dir in "${!file_groups[@]}"; do
  files=${file_groups[$dir]}
  branch_name="split-pr/$dir"
  git checkout -b $branch_name
  git reset ${{ github.event.pull_request.base.sha }}
  for file in $files; do
    git checkout ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }} -- "$file"
  done
  git commit -m "Split PR: $dir"
  git push origin $branch_name
  curl -X POST \
    https://api.github.com/repos/${{ github.repository }}/pulls \
    -H 'Authorization: Bearer '$GITHUB_TOKEN \
    -d '{"title": "Split PR: '$dir'", "head": "'$branch_name'", "base": "'${{ github.event.pull_request.base.ref }}'"}'
done

done

    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d "{\"buildType\":{\"id\":\"$config\"},\"branchName\":\"master\"}"
  while true; do
    STATUS=$(curl -s -u "$TC_USERNAME:$TC_PASSWORD" \
      "$TC_SERVER_URL/app/rest/builds/buildType:$config,status:running,branch:master,count:1")
    if [ "$(echo "$STATUS" | jq '.count')" == "0" ]; then
      break
    fi
    sleep 10
  done
done

git push origin main

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y subversion

cd svn-repo
svn add --force .
svn commit --non-interactive --trust-server-cert -m "Automated commit from GitHub Actions"

$fxcopcmd = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Enterprise\Team Tools\Static Analysis Tools\FxCop\FxCopCmd.exe"
&$fxcopcmd /file:"${{ github.workspace }}\YourProject.dll" /ruleSet:"=${{ github.workspace }}\YourProject.ruleset" /out:"${{ github.workspace }}\FxCopResults.xml"

git diff --no-index --diff-filter=M --name-only Approved Received | grep '.txt' | xargs -I {} echo "File {} differs"
git diff --no-index --diff-filter=M --name-only Approved Received | grep '.txt' && exit 1 || exit 0

if [ -n "$(git diff --no-index --diff-filter=M --name-only Received Approved | grep '.txt')" ]; then
  echo "Differences found in approval files"
  exit 1
fi
